{"step_by_step_thinking": "Calcium hydroxide is a common material used in pulpotomy procedures. It has a high pH which helps to neutralize the acidic environment caused by bacterial metabolism. It also has the ability to stimulate hard tissue formation. The calcium ions needed for the calcific bridge formation in a tooth where calcium hydroxide pulpotomy has been performed would come from the calcium hydroxide itself.", "answer_choice": "D. From the calcium hydroxide"}
